name: Occidental Grand Cozumel

reviews.text: I had no expectations for this resort after reading all the horrible reviews, but I was very pleasantly surprised. The resort is beautiful, with charming buildings, immaculate landscaping, and a wonderful sandy beach with calm waters. The rooms were large and attractively decorated. My favorite part of the resort was the shady hammock area on the beach. So relaxing. . .
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, hard-working staff
when can we go back?
reviews.text: Meals were good. The buffets always had a nice selection of fresh fruits and vegetables. I also appreciated the changes to the daily menu. The specialty restaurants didn't offer better food, but the dishes were beautifully plated and it was nice to be waited on. I don't understand the reviews that criticize the food so harshly. Everything was very fresh and pretty tasty. I wasn't expecting Jean Georges every night. Also, I had no problems booking reservations. There was no line, I just walked right up to the guest services woman and booked reservations for the whole week. It took about 3 minutes. Los Olivos, the Mediterranean restaurant, was the best of the three, I thought. I was always stuffed to the gills afterwards, but some people have complained about the portion sizes. If that's an issue, you can always ask for another portion or just run to the buffet or the pizza place, La Piazza, afterward.

reviews.title: lovely property, musty rooms
reviews.text: I'd never been to an all-inclusive resort so I was a bit apprehensive, but I think I might consider it again in the future. It's nice not having to think about the bill everytime you order a drink or sit down to a meal. All-inclusive means most activities at the resort. We paid separately for spa treatments. I got a mud wrap, which was wonderful. And my husband got a massage. I'd recommend getting a massage by the beach, which I didn't realize was an option until my last day there.

reviews.title: The Grand is Grand!!!!!!
reviews.text: For other activities, we rented a car for two days, visited some of the sites on the island, Chankanaab, Punta Sur, and the east side. We also went on a day trip to Chichen Itza, an old Mayan site, which was just amazing. Those are all extra.
All in all, it was a great getaway, and, I think, a very good value.
reviews.title: Great Wedding and honeymoon!!!
Wonderful Hotel...would definitely return
reviews.text: After reading reviews on this hotel before going we were unsure what to expect. We needn't have worried...everything was perfect. Check in took a total of 5 min..no problem to move to building 19 which we wanted(..closest to the beach) after a glass of champagne it was off to our room which was large and clean. Yes there is a mildewy smell in all the rooms we visted through the week but c/mon folks with humidity levels that hover around 60-80 % what does one expect?

reviews.title: Nice Grounds - Bad Food and Drinks
reviews.text: Our maid service was exceptional...cleanest hotel rooms ever with fresh towels twice daily.
Pools were very well maintained and never a problem getting loungers available to relax on.
reviews.title: Extremely nice vacation
The Grand is Grand!!!
reviews.text: Beach was same..easy availabilty of loungers and drinks served right to your chaise lounge.

reviews.title: Great week at the Grand Cozumel
reviews.text: Food was great..we never had any diffaculty finding things we liked to eat and we especially loved Los Olivos..(a ala carte mediteranean ). We found the service in all the restaurants and bars to be second to none. We were greeted always with a smile and our wine glass never was empty !! We booked a la carte 3 nights with absolutely no problem..at most a 5 minute wait each time.
Before booking we spent a couple hours reading reviews of previous guests and to be honest with you it gave us pause, but we booked at the Grand anyway.....and we're glad we did.
reviews.title: Do we have to leave ???
Great all around!!
reviews.text: We arrived around 1 PM and were immediately checked into our room, but told that it would not be ready for one hour. The bellboy told us he would watch our bags so we could explore the property. We walked around drinking in the beautiful surroundings and came back about 2 PM and were immediately ushered in a golf cart type of vehicle along with our bags to our room. The bellboy carried all our bags up and into our 3rd floor room. We requested a 3rd floor room on the advice of previous reviewers to help eliminate the noise and musty smell of first floor rooms. The room still smelled a bit musty, but you get used to it after a day or two.

The room was beautiful. It had a large bathroom with a shower that you could fit two people in if the need arose. We don't typically spend much non-sleeping time in the room, but it sure was nice to have such a spacious and well appointed room when we were there. Again, to those looking for New York quality...the fit and finish were not the best, but this is Mexico, you take a vacation to see and experience other cultures, living conditions, sights, sounds etc....so if you're expecting perfection, stay home and pick your own house apart.
reviews.title: Great vacation!!!

reviews.text: The grounds are fantastic. My wife and I never tired of walking around during various times of the day or evening and just experiencing the grounds. The place is just filled with every type of greenery, plant and tree you can imagine. Everything is manicured to virtual perfection in our opinion. It's especially nice to walk around in the warm evening air and just soak in the tropical atmosphere in such beautiful surroundings.
reviews.title: Occidental Grand Coz Rocks

reviews.text: We have to comment on the pool(s). We spent most of our pool time at first pool where things are a bit more quiet. I have no idea how they keep the water so sparkling and clear, but our eyes never burned after swimming and our skin never had the chlorine smell. I know they do treat the water cause I saw them doing it in the morning and evening....but whatever they are doing sure worked well.
reviews.title: Royal club, it is worth it
Great if you're over 35....
reviews.text: The hotel was really nice, you have a jungle feel with some iguanas walking around, but yet you are steps from the beach. It is a great place if you want to relax but as far as partying, Cancun and Acapulco are 100 times better. The food was average (American buffet) and the drinks were weak, however, the ocean and peacefulness made up for it. Be advised that this is not a place for 20 somethings looking to party, most people we saw were 35+, with the average age in the 40's. Also, we highly recommend diving, it was our first time and the instructor Laura was fantastic, really helpful.

reviews.title: Nice hotel--terrible food/service
reviews.text: WE stayed there 4-19 TO 4-24. We have stayed at many all-incl and this was the worst concerning food. BUFFET BREAKFAST not many choices, BUFFET DINNER NO TASTE. The 3 SPECIALTY REST. you need to get in line by 8:15AM to reserve that night. Most of the time we couldn't get the time we wanted OR the resturant was CLOSED. OR there was a WEDDING RECP. going on there. We had 2 ADULTS AND 2 TEEN AGE BOYS. They asked for another meal (BECAUSE PORTIONS ARE VERY SMALL) and they said NO. So every night we had to go up to the pizza place, wait to get our pizza 30-45MIN. I thought ALL-INCL was as much as you want?? AFTER 10PM the only food AVAILABLE IS THE PIZZA PLACE. Nothing is already made to go. You have to WAIT FOR EVERYTHING. The BEACH LUNCH you have to sit down W/SHOES,SHIRT, SHORTS AND you can't take food out of THE REST. We ate dinner downtown 1 NIGHT-VERY GOOD. Other than that. The grounds were well kept, ROOM CLEAN, BARTENDERS GREAT. Not MUCH for teens To do -DISC-POOL table CLOSED TO TEENS AT 10PM. IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS E-MAIL ME

description: Only the Caribbean’s most famous reef system could match the beauty and splendor of the Occidental Grand Cozumel, which is exactly why the two exist side-by-side. Located on Cozumel’s gorgeous San Francisco beach, just above the bottomless blue paradise of the Palancar Reef system, you’ll find an authentic-style state that delivers all the luxuries of a private oceanside hacienda. Gourmet dining, bright and airy rooms, nightly music and entertainment, daily sports and beach activities and an on-site spa and salon make the Occidental grand Cozumel the jewel of any Caribbean experience.
